Show HN: I Built Four Eight-Foot-Long Handwriting Robots

stories.text:
I've been reading a lot about micro-startups lately, and one of the primary questions I am failing to understand is that how are entrepreneurs able to acquire customers for their product?

I am skeptical of the capabilities of the micro-saas culture, the only way it seems to work is if there already a customer base for the product and somehow you are able to capture the customer base by either shorting the competition or building tremendous value.

The customer base itself is developed through twitter and other social media channels. I don't think these micro-startups have complexity or challenges that native startups inherently have (product-market fit)

Any good experts or resources that guide me through this turmoil? What I am expecting is a step by step guide that can help me generate let's say $500 MRR?

I understand what I am requesting is difficult, however I am only looking for the way?
stories.title: Ask HN: Micro-SaaS

stories.text:
I'm mainly a back end dev, but with a new in-house project I need to be able to ship a simple HTML page with the outputs of another process (like a report). Id prefer to avoid the bigger css and js frameworks if possible when making a biscuits layout, for transportability, simplicity, and conflict minimisation.

What is your go to for a very simple HTML page drag and drop style builder? Despite the simplicity desired I'd still like something at least a little nice looking.
stories.title: Ask HN: What's your go to for building quick and simple HTML/JS layouts?
